insights.title: Spending collapsed 100% vs. prior period
insights.observation: Your total spend dropped from $525,000 in the previous 90‑day window to $0 in the current period, a -100% change.
insights.recommendation: Investigate the root cause (e.g., contract expirations, budget freeze, data feed outage) and re‑activate purchasing or correct reporting as soon as possible.

insights.title: Supplier base eliminated
insights.observation: The number of active suppliers fell from 1 to 0, a -100% change, removing all existing supplier relationships.
insights.recommendation: Review contracts and re‑establish relationships with at least one reliable supplier to avoid supply‑chain interruptions; consider onboarding backup suppliers.

insights.title: Current spend far below industry median
insights.observation: Your current spend of $0 is 100% lower than the industry median spend of $531,781 and well below the 25th‑percentile benchmark of $41,999.
insights.recommendation: Benchmark your procurement strategy against peers; if the zero spend reflects a deliberate pause, develop a phased re‑spending plan aligned with market norms.

insights.title: Supplier count below industry norms
insights.observation: Having 0 active suppliers puts you below the 25th‑percentile benchmark of 1 supplier and far under the platform average of 3.7 suppliers.
insights.recommendation: Target a minimum of 2‑3 active suppliers to meet the industry average, reducing concentration risk and improving negotiation leverage.

insights.title: Combined: Zero spend vs. active market
insights.observation: While peers are spending tens of millions (average $66 M) and purchasing thousands of units, your organization recorded no spend, quantity, or items in the last 90 days.
insights.recommendation: Conduct an urgent cross‑functional review (finance, operations, procurement) to confirm whether this reflects a strategic pause, data ingestion error, or supply disruption, and implement corrective actions.

insights.title: Combined: No price‑per‑unit data to benchmark
insights.observation: With zero items purchased, avg price per unit cannot be calculated, preventing cost‑efficiency comparisons to the industry avg of $2625 per unit (historical) and platform benchmarks.
insights.recommendation: Resume purchasing activity on at least one SKU to generate price‑per‑unit data; then compare against the industry average to identify cost‑saving opportunities.
